snippet: Some lawyers are identifying New York City businesses where there are violations of the Americans With Disabilities Act, then finding disabled plaintiffs to develop lawsuits.
abstract: Small cadre of lawyers are developing lawsuits by identifying businesses in New York City that are not in compliance with the American With Disabilities Act, and then aggressively recruiting plaintiffs from advocacy groups for people with disabilities; practice sets off debate about whether the suits are a laudable effort, because they force businesses to make physical improvements to comply with the law, or simply a form of ambulance-chasing, with no one actually having been injured.
lead_paragraph: Some lawyers are identifying New York City businesses where there are violations of the Americans With Disabilities Act, then finding disabled plaintiffs to develop lawsuits.

headline.seo: Lawyers Find Obstacles to the Disabled, Then Find Plaintiffs
headline.main: Disabilities Act Prompts Flood of Suits Some Cite as Unfair
headline.print_headline: Disabilities Act Used By Lawyers In Flood Of Suits
